tweets.text:
New use cases for @openclaw:

* Self-evolving personal CRM - tracks relationship details of people I email with

* Food tracker (been having stomach issues) - tracks my meals by text or photos, will run analysis later

* RAG knowledge base - ingests articles, videos, tweets, that i can later recall for videos

I installed TeamViewer on my OpenClaw machine and use Cursor/Codex to update the code directly. 

Also allows me to restart the gateway remotely in case of failure.

Weekends are for AI and systems building. 

Weekdays are for ruthless execution.
Imagine thinking the acceleration will slow down for you üòÇ all aboard people, the gear is permanently changed.

I'm a hacker and for 15 years I've worked on the offensive side - which is why this is not coming from a defensive frame of mind/opinion.

I'm watching my own community (cybersecurity) laugh at AI slop while completely missing the point.

Yeah, there will be mistakes. New vulnerabilities. That's what happens with any new tech. But security people sitting on the sidelines saying "ha ha look at that garbage" think they're being smart when they're actually getting left behind.

You can't just point fingers anymore. If you're too busy mocking AI to learn how to work with it, you'll get replaced by a sixty-dollar Anthropic subscription.

The acceleration is real. Your "sorry I'm on the spectrum" excuses won't save your job.
gm to everyone who is about to spend excessive time analysing these beer coasters üòéü´° https://t.co/gfxcPFOatJ

Good morning my dear friends!‚òÉÔ∏è

I wish you a joyful and relaxing Sunday filled with sunshine, laughter, and moments that make your heart smile ‚òïÔ∏è

Make with Midjourney & @grok Imagine ‚ùÑÔ∏è https://t.co/iDXxWFh15l

Within 2 days, all of my early access customers of https://t.co/HMjWoQP8jq are going to have this same dashboard ‚Äì with their own AI agents ‚Äì working on their own mission.

The mission can be anything they define...

Some of the customers I have talked to also have multiple missions (multiple businesses),
and they are planning to create multiple accounts ‚Äì one for each mission...

I will try to personally onboard as many people as I can...
It is going to be so exciting to see how everyone is going to use it.

I want to see others experience the same thing I did when I first built this...

Once I am confident that everyone is satisfied with how their agents are doing, that's when I will do a proper launch and let everyone in automatically.

I never expected this ü§Ø

Over 50+ people have signed up to https://t.co/HMjWoQP8jq early access in the first 24 hrs.

It all started as an internal dashboard where I wanted to have a team of specialist AI agents working and collaborating with each other to fulfil a mission.

After I built it internally, I wrote an article on X about how I built it. I went into a great detail about the architecture and how everything is built.

So many people since then have been asking me to turn this into a product so that they can also use it.

And I just did that...

Now, I will go lock in and deliver this to everyone who trusted me with this and decided to join early.

Saturday night. 6 hours of sleep over the last week.

My autonomous agent company having an emergency meeting on the left. My ClawdBot giving them new tasks on the right

All being powered by local models in my Mac Studio data center

I refuse to be in the permanent underclass https://t.co/XmdC3p7H1z

Hey @AnthropicAI just to let you know...

If you stuck with the name "Claude Code SDK" instead of renaming it "Claude Agent SDK" you'd have 10x the amount of people using it.
